Generate box plot or violin plot to show how errors are distributed

Source: R/evalMetrics.R
distErrorPlot.Rd

Generate violin plot or box plot to show how errors are distributed by proportion bins of 0.1. The errors can be displayed all mixed or splited by cell type (CellType) or number of cell types present in the samples (nCellTypes). See facet.by argument and examples for more information.

distErrorPlot(
  object,
  error,
  colors,
  x.by = "pBin",
  facet.by = NULL,
  color.by = "nCellTypes",
  filter.sc = TRUE,
  error.label = FALSE,
  pos.x.label = 4.6,
  pos.y.label = NULL,
  size.point = 0.1,
  alpha.point = 1,
  type = "violinplot",
  ylimit = NULL,
  nrow = NULL,
  ncol = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  theme = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

DigitalDLSorter object with trained.model slot containing metrics in test.deconv.metrics slot of DigitalDLSorterDNN object.
error

Which error is going to be represented. Available errors are absolute error ('AbsErr'), proportional absolute error ('ppAbsErr'), squared error ('SqrErr') or proportional squared error ('ppSqrErr').
colors

Vector of colors to use. Only vectors with a number of colors equal to or greater than the levels of color.by will be accepted. By default a list of custom colors provided by the package is used.
x.by

Variable used for X axis. When facet.by is not NULL, the best option is pBin (probability bins). The options are nCellTypes (by number of different cell types), CellType (by cell type) and pBin.
facet.by

Variable used to display data in different panels. If it is NULL, the plot is not separated into different panels. The options are nCellTypes (by number of different cell types) and CellType (by cell type).
color.by

Variable used to color data. The options are nCellTypes and CellType.
filter.sc

Boolean indicating whether to filter single-cell profiles and only display errors associated with bulk samples (TRUE by default).
error.label

Boolean indicating if to show average error as annotation in plots (FALSE by default).
pos.x.label

Position on the X axis of the errors annotations.
pos.y.label

Position on the Y axis of the errors annotations.
size.point

Size of points (0.1 by default).
alpha.point

Alpha of points (0.1 by default).
type

Type of plot: 'boxplot' or 'violinplot'. The latter by default.
ylimit

Upper limit in y axis if it is required (NULL by default).
nrow

Number of rows if facet.by is different from NULL.
ncol

Number of columns if facet.by is different from NULL.
title

Title of the plot.
theme

ggplot2 theme.
...

Additional arguments for facet_wrap ggplot2 function if facet.by is not equal to NULL.

Value

ggplot2 plot

See also

calculateEvalMetrics corrExpPredPlot blandAltmanLehPlot barErrorPlot

Examples

if (requireNamespace("digitalDLSorteRdata", quietly = TRUE)) {
  library(digitalDLSorteRdata)
  data(DDLSLiComp)
  DDLSLiComp <- calculateEvalMetrics(
    object = DDLSLiComp
  )
  distErrorPlot(
    object = DDLSLiComp,
    error = "AbsErr",
    facet.by = "CellType",
    color.by = "nCellTypes",
    error.label = TRUE
  )

  distErrorPlot(
    object = DDLSLiComp,
    error = "AbsErr",
    x.by = "CellType",
    facet.by = NULL,
    filter.sc = FALSE,
    color.by = "CellType",
    error.label = TRUE
  )
}
